rename.from: [bug] only the first created window receives events on Linux
rename.to: [bug] only the first window receives tauri events on Linux

body:
It appears that this bug was introduced in tauri version `2.0.0-rc.16`.

I tested with `tauri` pinned to version `=2.0.0-rc.15` and `tauri-utils` pinned to version `=2.0.0-rc.12`, and the bug does not occur

rename.from: [bug] only the first window receives tauri events on Linux
rename.to: [bug] borked event handling for multiple windows on Linux in Tauri v2.0.0-rc.16

body: My guess is #11043 might be related
The problem still exists on Tauri 2.0.0 stable

rename.from: [bug] borked event handling for multiple windows on Linux in Tauri v2.0.0-rc.16
rename.to: [bug] broken event listening in multi window app on Linux

body:
I just ran into this today too.

One other thing I noticed is that the injected window in the `#[command]` is always the main window, too.

For example, this prints `main` on Linux, when it prints `settings` on macOS

```rust
#[tauri::command]
async fn cmd_update_settings(settings: Settings, w: WebviewWindow) -> Result<Settings, String> {
    println!("UPDATE SETTINGS {}", w.label());
    update_settings(&w, settings)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| e.to_string())
}
```
Perhaps the same root cause, but it seems like `data-tauri-drag-region="true"` is also broken in additional windows on Linux
Manually reverting the changes made in #11043 solved the problem, but re-introduced #10981.

> I just ran into this today too.
> 
> One other thing I noticed is that the injected window in the `#[command]` is always the main window, too.
> 
> For example, this prints `main` on Linux, when it prints `settings` on macOS
> 
> ```rust
> #[tauri::command]
> async fn cmd_update_settings(settings: Settings, w: WebviewWindow) -> Result<Settings, String> {
>     println!("UPDATE SETTINGS {}", w.label());
>     update_settings(&w, settings)
>         .await
>         .map_err(|e| e.to_string())
> }
> ```

I'm fairly certain this is the cause of the "event listening issue" I described.
The `listen` command is getting the wrong webview object.

I think I figured out the problem:

https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/193dc4e35ad4caa5ca51d30c807508656679798a/crates/tauri-runtime-wry/src/lib.rs#L4136-L4162

As documented, on Linux, custom protocols are associated with the web context and thus we can't register a scheme more than once.

However, every webview want its own `tauri`, `ipc` and `asset` handlers.

On Linux, only the first window's handlers are registered.
Secondary windows' handlers are simply ignored.

Some ideas for potential fix:

On the short term, we can:
Use separate web context (revert #11043) and accept desyned local storage (reopen #10981) for now.

To completely fix the problem,
we need to include the window label in `InvokeRequest` and update the `ipc` handler to route requests based on that.

rename.from: [bug] broken event listening in multi window app on Linux
rename.to: [bug] broken IPC in multi window app on Linux

issue.title: fix: IPC on multiwindowed linux apps (fix #11171)

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update example for `App::show`
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.changes/README.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` and `cargo clippy` passes.
6. Propose your changes as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->

closes #11171

- Fix ipc on multiwindowed linux apps
- Include window label in `InvokeRequest`
- Update the IPC handler to fetch webview based on the window label in `InvokeRequest`

issue.title: tauri: migrating to V2

repository.name: launcher
repository.description: A launcher for the OpenGOAL Project to simplify usage and installation

issue.body:
Fixes #529
Fixes #581
Fixes #224

~~May potentially solve #581 as it uses a newer version of webkit2gtk -- im currently convinced the UI rendering bug is the fault of webkitgtk2, and i tested last night that on newer versions (i used GNOME Web) it doesn't manifest.~~
- Confirmed to solve the issue, though it causes others  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/webkit2gtk/+bug/2081166

Before merging:
- [x] make sure the release process works (test on a fork)
  - [x] don't forget to do #224
- [x] test on all operating systems
  - [x] windows
  - [x] macos
  - [x] linux
    - tested here https://github.com/open-goal/launcher/issues/701#issuecomment-2764665002

This is blocked for the following reasons:
- Linux
  - https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/11171 (our app is multi-window and it doesn't seem to work properly, i had to temporarily make it a single window app to get it to even launch)
  - https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/10626 (bad webkit version out there? upstream ubuntu bug report https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/webkit2gtk/+bug/2081166)

issue.title: fix(workaround): temporary workaround broken multi window ipc issue
